oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter to James McGonnigal from Jonathan Ingram
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Jonathan Ingram to James McGonnigal addressed to dear brother although the men do not have the same last name. Ingram describes his role in the war as a member of the Indiana Legion who were called out to deal with John Hunt Morgan's raid.; He asks about McGonnigal's role in the Confederate Army. These men may have been Odd Fellow Brothers. McGonnigal left Indiana and moved to Nashville before the war and joined the 1st Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. He spent the war working on the railroads.
